body:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TjA7-M5njkI1F38IC0pm305S9EOmxcUwaCIvaSmansg/edit?usp=drivesdk included an "always update" lockfile under the output base for reproducible extensions. We didn't implement it at the time simply because we didn't have examples of slow but reproducible extensions. Now that we do, I think that we should implement this.

@Wyverald @meteorcloudy What do you think?
I think it's a good idea, I guess `bazel clean --expunge` should still nuke it?
Yes, it would behave similar to the local action cache and be stored directly under the output base.

SGTM!

> Now that we do, I think that we should implement this.

Just for the record, what are some examples of slow but reproducible extensions?

issue.title: Fix edge cases in lockfile handling

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
* Don't run the core logic when `--lockfile_mode` is `off` or `error` but the command doesn't forward options to Skyframe.
* Honor `reproducible` per extension eval factor, not per extension.
* Fix encoding conflict between isolation key and `use_repo_rule`'s fake extension names

This doesn't require a lockfile version bump as `use_repo_rule`'s fake extension (so far) isn't included in the lockfile.

Work towards #24723

issue.title: Use a persistent lockfile to speed up reproducible extensions

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Reproducible extensions are not included in the regular lockfile in order to keep it small and less prone to merge conflicts. But reproducible extensions can still take significant time to evaluate, which currently happens on every server restart. 

This commit makes it so that Bazel maintains an additional lockfile, stored under the output base and not visible to the user. It only records information that remain correct indefinitely, such as the results of reproducible extensions as well as hashes of module files from registries. See the comments on BazelLockFileValue for a detailed comparison of the contents of the two lockfiles.

Fixes #24723

issue.title: Persistent storage for module extension evaluation.

labels.name: P2
labels.description: We'll consider working on this in future. (Assignee optional)

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Description of the feature request:


This has been discussed in [this Slack thread](https://bazelbuild.slack.com/archives/C014RARENH0/p1734683703459389?thread_ts=1734659269.635149&cid=C014RARENH0)
And it is outlined in [this proposal document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1TjA7-M5njkI1F38IC0pm305S9EOmxcUwaCIvaSmansg/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.vvlzzcv3akok)

### Which category does this issue belong to?

This is about `bzlmod` extension evaluation.

### What underlying problem are you trying to solve with this feature?


I would like to store URL, sha256 values that I can fetch from the PyPI index. That is something that is a by product of the extension evaluation and I would like to reuse that in future evaluations.

---

Just to be clear, my intention would be to use this in `rules_python` when we download these facts available through PyPI server:
1. e.g. Distribution `a` for version `b` has artifacts downloadable at `X` with hash `Y`.
2. Artifacts downloadable at `X` have further METADATA files associated with other hashes.

I would like to mark the extension as reproducible so that only the facts are persisted in the `MODULE.bazel.lock` file. For my usecase arch/os dependent facts are not needed.

issue.title: [8.0.1] Streamline `ModuleExtensionId#toString()` & Fix edge cases in lockfile handling

labels.name: team-ExternalDeps
labels.description: External dependency handling, remote repositiories, WORKSPACE file.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
### Streamline `ModuleExtensionId#toString()`

Currently `ModuleExtensionId#toString()` uses the default Java record repr, which isn't very user-friendly. There's really no reason not to use the `asTargetString()` method instead. This PR just renames `asTargetString()` to `toString()` and updates all call sites.

Closes #24450.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 700050362
Change-Id: I82238d2134e1642694f0b20235fcfe9307ceaa7d 
(cherry picked from commit d23421a01d15b9bf03baaed293fd07f348cd9baf)

### Fix edge cases in lockfile handling

* Don't run the core logic when `--lockfile_mode` is `off` or `error` but the command doesn't forward options to Skyframe.
* Honor `reproducible` per extension eval factor, not per extension.
* Fix encoding conflict between isolation key and `use_repo_rule`'s fake extension names

This doesn't require a lockfile version bump as `use_repo_rule`'s fake extension (so far) isn't included in the lockfile.

Work towards #24723

Closes #24754.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 712623562
Change-Id: I61fd439539031a01ddec4488276ff2d0484849f2 
(cherry picked from commit cfda17808d84d3af06158c49be250b15b82b7925)

Fixes #24754
